text: In a managed services data center relocation in utilities where hardware lead times are long and a tender deadline is approaching, what should the project manager do to define resource requirements and needs?

options.label: analyze the work to identify skill, role, and quantity needs
assume the current team can cover all skills
request all possible skills just in case
ignore calendars and holidays in estimates

explanation: Option a is correct because clear requirements precede acquisition. Option b is incorrect because assumptions risk gaps. Option c is incorrect because over-requesting wastes budget. Option d is incorrect because availability affects capacity.

text: Given a design-bid-build grid upgrade in construction where vendors control key components and operations must support handover, which action best supports define resource requirements and needs?

options.label: delay defining needs until execution
build a capacity plan with calendars and constraints
let vendors decide staffing without oversight
assume the current team can cover all skills

explanation: Option b is correct because capacity planning makes needs realistic. Option a is incorrect because late clarity slows staffing. Option c is incorrect because uncontrolled staffing risks misfit. Option d is incorrect because assumptions risk gaps.

text: While facing a turnkey grid upgrade in utilities where specialized skills are scarce and budget approval is pending, what is the most effective next step to define resource requirements and needs?

options.label: request all possible skills just in case
ignore calendars and holidays in estimates
consider build vs buy and location factors
delay defining needs until execution

explanation: Option c is correct because options affect cost and schedule. Option a is incorrect because over-requesting wastes budget. Option b is incorrect because availability affects capacity. Option d is incorrect because late clarity slows staffing.

text: For a managed services grid upgrade in biotech where supplier performance is uneven and compliance terms are strict, what should the project manager do first to define resource requirements and needs?

options.label: let vendors decide staffing without oversight
assume the current team can cover all skills
request all possible skills just in case
validate needs with functional leads

explanation: Option d is correct because stakeholder input refines requirements. Option a is incorrect because uncontrolled staffing risks misfit. Option b is incorrect because assumptions risk gaps. Option c is incorrect because over-requesting wastes budget.

text: In a turnkey data center relocation in logistics where contracts are in negotiation and budget approval is pending, what should the project manager do to define resource requirements and needs?

options.label: account for onboarding and ramp-up time
ignore calendars and holidays in estimates
delay defining needs until execution
let vendors decide staffing without oversight

explanation: Option a is correct because ramp time influences availability. Option b is incorrect because availability affects capacity. Option c is incorrect because late clarity slows staffing. Option d is incorrect because uncontrolled staffing risks misfit.
